website_summaries.verdict: An affordable yet well-made sleeper that makes it easy to reach infants.
pros: Soft yet protective, with supportive locking sides – good quality for the price
It also gets top marks from parents for how lightweight and easy to transport it is
cons: Sides are too low for some
Padded sides can't be removed to wash

customer_reviews.title: False advertising
customer_reviews.text: THis product is advertised online as 100% polyester. Some previous consumers mentioned under Q&A that the mattress is actually made of polyurethane, but this company stated under Q&A that, once again, this product is 100% polyester. I gave it a chance and ordered it. Upon receipt of the product today we searched for a tag indicating materials used in the mattress. We had to take off the sheet to find the mattress tag. This tag stated 100% polyurethane!!!!!! Needless to say, our newborn will NOT be sleeping in this and the product is getting returned ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Regan

customer_reviews.title: Best side sleep for newborns!
customer_reviews.text: This side sleeper is amazing! We don't want to hold our daughter when we sleep because of the safety risks. We also didn't want some soft sleeper like a dockatot, not that they aren't nice. This sleeper has a mattress much like a basinet so hopefully the transition will be easier. The mesh allows her to press against the sides without suffocating. The metal frame keeps us from rolling on top of it. It fits right in the middle of our queen bed, allowing us both enough room to sleep. We couldn't ask for a better product. The price is a steal too!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this primarily for the mesh siding on it. Our baby girl kept rolling sideways in her bassinet and getting her face awfully close to the sides (which are made of cloth.) I was terrified that she'd smother herself so we bought this co-sleeper. At first it seemed almost too big for her tiny frame, but now she's definitely growing into it nicely! She loves sleeping in it, too. There's times she just doesn't want to be held and as soon as I lay her down in the co-sleeper, she gets this happy look on her face. My only complaint is that one of the sides is stuck and won't let me fold it up for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Best nights’ sleep I’ve had in days
customer_reviews.text: Our baby will not sleep in a crib or cradle, and having him in bed with us makes us nervous. Enter this handy contraption which keeps him close enough that he’s happy, but isolated enough that he’s safe from me rolling over on him. Now I’m finally sleeping soundly again. Super easy to set up, and lightweight. Feels a tiny bit flimsy, but that’s a fair trade off for the mesh sides and lightweight construction that make it easy even for my postpartum wife to lift and move. Cons: it is really hard to cuddle with this thing in between us :(
customer_reviews.author: opiate

customer_reviews.title: Not a firm, safe sleep surface
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely not a safe sleep product. The pad is a very soft pillow and it doesn’t have anything firm to lay on. Once you lay your baby on it he sinks in. The concept is awesome, but it’s not JPMA certified either so your child should not be sleeping in it. I was hoping it was a nice firm surface, but it is definitely not.
customer_reviews.author: Sfam

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind for me, but do your research before use
customer_reviews.text: I personally love this cosleeper bassinet but I did a lot of research and am aware of potential risks associated with using it. My son sleeps great and I sleep a lot better being able to see him right next to me. A bedside bassinet isn't an option because of our bed size and room layout (the bed is inset into the wall a bit) so this made me feel so much better about being able to easily check on my son at night. I read a lot of comments about polyurethane being used for the mattress, the mattress is 100% polyurethane. The rest of the material is all polyester though.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy the deluxe, just get the regular
customer_reviews.text: I went ahead and purchased the deluxe unit because we have a similar bassinet with noises and vibration that my baby loves. After a week of using, the vibration stopped but the noise continued to work. The noises or sounds on this are a bit creepy, but it doesn’t seem to bother my baby. The heart beat sound is the favorite. The “mattress” doesn’t seem very comfortable, but it is flat. I don’t like the large metal bars, as I feel my baby may roll to the side and suffocate. So you have to be careful on where you place them in the bassinet. Overall though, it was helpful for transitioning him to cosleeping.
customer_reviews.author: Mandee

customer_reviews.title: It's a perfect bassinet! Babies are unpredictable though
customer_reviews.text: It's a perfect bassinet! Babies are unpredictable though, and I thought our baby girl would be like our son and want to sleep with us all the time ( actually that's the only way he would sleep as a baby) but she has surprised me and actually sleeps very well in her crib so I have not had to use this but a handful of times. It did come in handy big time when we traveled and stayed at a hotel, didn't have to lug along the big pack and play. It's perfect for the price! A safe space to sleep for baby.
customer_reviews.author: Erin H.

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: We have the co sleeper that goes in the bed. Will say it does work best for king size bed. Minor annoyance is blanket issues but we just have our own separate ones so they do not touch the co sleeper. Will suggest to individuals who do not move around a lot while sleeping. Easy to assemble and easy to clean. Great for baby who is a sound sleeper our little one is almost 5 months and still sleeps in this. He hardly moves while sleeping and I like the ease of it since we exclusively breastfeed. So basically 100% satisfied with purchase and do reccomend.
customer_reviews.author: VorpahlFam

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little travel bed
customer_reviews.text: This makes an awesome little travel bed for our newborn grandbaby. He can easily some see grandma at the lake and have his own sleeping area on my bed next to me without fear that I will roll over on him. He can see out of it which is much better for him since he does not like being down inside the bassinet. I would recommend this as a temporary bed for any grandmother. Easy to clean, the sheets fit very well, easy to put together and easy to carry. I put all of the baby stuff back in it when it is time for baby to leave. Just an awesome little bed.
customer_reviews.author: Kezbeth

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I bought the deluxe kind hoping my baby would like it but no. It was a waste of my money. My baby never slept on it because the mattress it comes with was plastic and not comfortable. Please buy a doc-a-tot instead. That’s what I did.
customer_reviews.author: Somewhat satisfied

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely a life saver,I have crib and a bassinet that goes next to my bed but my baby refused to sleep in either one,she would only sleep in the bed with me and her father and I was so afraid of rolling over on her at night,and then I found this..this is so wonderful she sleeps all night and is only 8 weeks old..this is perfect for co sleeping,it keeps her safe while still having her right next to me,it does take up some space on our bed but it's so worth it,this is a must have if u r a co sleeper.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda champion

customer_reviews.title: Mattress possibly PVC?
customer_reviews.text: Mattress label does not list what it's made off so I would have to assume it's PVC with polyurethane foam inside. If the outer part is TPU then please add it to the listing and label because pvc is definitely not safe for babies to sleep on. Also - the mattress is about an inch thick and there are metal bars around it (we got the deluxe version which has padding around the top metal bars but not the bottom which are around the baby's head)
customer_reviews.author: Mr. D

customer_reviews.title: Safe sleeping and napping spot - works well for co-sleeping as well.
customer_reviews.text: Worried about co-sleeping? Get this. Fits between people in a bed- keep the covers away but gives baby his/her own space to sleep and most importantly- breathe! With all the SIDS and 'back to sleep' and 'no covers' and everything being recalled, you basically don't feel safe letting your baby sleep in anything. They can safely sleep in this. We were always confident we could put our baby down in this and she would be fine. Could even put her in the bed with us in this and not have to worry. Sides are made of breathable mesh- I have no idea what people are thinking using those dock-a-tot pillows.
customer_reviews.author: Physick

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for c section recovery
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed. The sturdy frame makes me confident I won’t roll over on baby. The sides are low enough that I can pick up and put down baby after c section with minimal discomfort. The mesh sides make me feel better breathing wise than the cushiony styles. The middle piece that’s kind of collapsible is perfect for being able to rub her back etc. while she’s in there and I’m laying down comfy. This thing is definitely perfect for an easy to reach place for baby to sleep to make life easier after c section recovery or for anyone who wants to cosleep but is nervous about safety.
customer_reviews.author: Sea Breeze Sleep

customer_reviews.title: Base is soft, need to set on hard surfaces or really firm mattress
customer_reviews.text: The base is too soft for newborns. You need to place it on a hard surface or really firm mattress. Or it will sunken a little bit while you put your baby in. Not a super big deal, but that bother me since my baby spitting up a lot so we need to adjust him to sleep with an angle so he can sleep better but this sleepers just cannot hold it base flat while we set the angle.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Nice concept and design. May work for you.
customer_reviews.text: We opened this product and put it on our bed to see how much space it would take up but my husband really doesn’t like this at all. I thought it would be great and I’d feel better knowing the baby is safer between us but he doesn’t like feeling so separated from the baby and the metal parts. The mattress pad is pretty noisy, like another reviewer stated, and the color is a little creamier than the white color in the photo...not that that’s important. The baby isn’t here yet so we really don’t know what it would be like but we are returning this for a portable, standing bassinet.
customer_reviews.author: 2 Corinthians 5:7

customer_reviews.title: Not sure how baby feels about it.
customer_reviews.text: Because the bottom of this Co-Sleeper is completely flat, my baby tended to turn if it was placed in bed with us. She didn't seem to like how open it was compared to her rocker, which kind of curves around her body. We put a rolled-up towel underneath the cushion so that the sides came up a little. Although that helped, she had trouble falling asleep in it even with us right there. It seems well-made, but perhaps is not very comfortable for her.
customer_reviews.author: M. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for co sleeping or travel napping
customer_reviews.text: This was a cute idea. I got this to co sleep with my daughter. Ended up not using because it made me nervous. Not that the product did anything to make me that way. I am just a worry wart. It was a fantastic idea and I would recommend it to anyone willing to try cosleeping or on the travel napping. Neutral colors, breathable material, and easy folding.
customer_reviews.author: Kass

customer_reviews.title: Temporary
customer_reviews.text: This is great for temporary use. Although for the price, it's a little too much for something that doesn't have a real "mattress pad" (its more like a diaper changing pad than a mattress). In the description, it says it comes with a fitted sheet - didn't get that! A sheet would have been nice because now we have milk stains on it. It also didn't have an instruction packet (in our box), which would have been helpful! Both the mesh and the mattress pad are flimsy, but the metal frame is very sturdy. Baby used this only for the first few weeks after birth and that's it.
customer_reviews.author: Sanda Rathamone

customer_reviews.title: Great for co-sleeping!
customer_reviews.text: Our son slept best in bed with us when he was first born... which gave me HUGE anxiety because I used to work for CPS and know the terrible things that can happen. This fit perfectly between us in our king size bed (and we're not small people lol) and the little net part in the middle didn't hurt our arms/wrists when keeping our hand on his chest to help him fall/stay asleep. Overall, a great purchase for us and worth the money even though we only ended up using it for about a month. (You will have to use 2 blankets to sleep though if you put this in the middle, just FYI.)
customer_reviews.author: Amanda J.

customer_reviews.title: Returning item
customer_reviews.text: Bought bc baby will not sleep alone and wanted to cosleep safely. Well, my son hates it. It’s ungainly, takes up a lot of room. Frame is sturdy, but foam and whatnot smells weird—doesn’t seem easy to wash. It would be nice to have extra sheets for it. If you move in bed, the product will move towards you, disturbing baby and being potentially unsafe. May be good for some, but not for us.
customer_reviews.author: New mama

customer_reviews.title: Worry free co-sleeper
customer_reviews.text: I have an expensive bassinet sitting right next to my bed, and yet my baby is sleeping in the middle of us, cozy In this bassinet. Best purchase. My husband told me it would be a waste and now admits it’s amazing. The baby sleeps in our bed, worry free of rolling on him and he is always an arms reach of us. I love that I can look over and see him. You wont regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nrose

customer_reviews.title: Never made it a whole night using the SwaddleMe Side Sleeper
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. The base is so rigid it leans in whatever direction the mattress goes. So if by the very nature of sleeping next to the sleeper, it tilts in the direction of the parent and baby slides to the edge. The mattress portion is also very similar to a pack-n-play, only harder and louder if baby moves. Also impossible to break back down once assembled.
customer_reviews.author: John Selick, IV

customer_reviews.title: Baby had her own crib on vacation!!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for a vacation recently. The hotel didn’t offer a crib for rental and we couldn’t fit our rock and play sleeper into our luggage. We looked through so many options here on Amazon but many were either too big or too flimsy (based on the reviews). We chose this cosleeper because of the size and the reviews from previous purchasers. We used it next to the bed, not on it, and we’re very pleased! She had her own bed and was very comfortable. She is 3 months and 15 pounds, she doesn’t have too much longer before she would be too big for this btw. But... it was worth the buy.
customer_reviews.author: MsBitters

customer_reviews.title: False Advertisement/ Health Hazard
customer_reviews.text: Product details state that it is 100% polyester however that is not the case. Once I removed the mattress cover for further inspection of my new swaddleme bassinet hi saw the tag that clearly states that it is made of 100% polyurethane foam. Evidence shows that it isn't the best material for a baby to sleep on, with health hazards eminently present. Polyurethane foam is no longer deemed safe for babies, as shown by a study published in Environmental Science & Technology. I was super excited about our new swaddleme but we will be sending this one back because our child's health is what matters. Thumbs way down for the false advertisement.
customer_reviews.author: Marc A Saldina

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like a good option for those early days when you’re up constantly with a newborn. However, it’s difficult to figure out the blanket situation (don’t want to put under blankets for safety reasons, but it you put it on top of blankets, it’s hard for mom and dad to cover up). Also, when on top of blankets, it becomes uneven and baby does not lay flat. My daughter hated this and wouldn’t sleep in it for even a moment, so we never used it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah P

customer_reviews.title: Game changer!
customer_reviews.text: This was a game changer for us. We have the swaddle me by your side bassinet and it’s great but our girl just sleeps better next to us and this gave her the comfort/security she needed. It’s very light weight and sturdy but it does take up space. We have a king downstairs and a queen upstairs. Only one person and our 90lb dog sleeps with her in the queen bed. In the king everybody can fit nicely. I really didn’t think I’d ever get a bed cosleeper but I am so happy I did. We love this one!
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: CAME DIRTY AND USED
customer_reviews.text: This came USED ! I’m from Canada and I purchased this product, paid $60 shipping and import fees and it came with animal fur and a cup ring on it. I received late yesterday and didn’t notice these issues until this morning. We don’t have an animal and did not put a cup on this item. I unfortunately used this last night and I’m hoping she doesn’t get a rash or germs. she did sleep great (and me too) which is why I’m rating 3 stars. If it came clean, it would be 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Cave

customer_reviews.title: This product was great for my DD
customer_reviews.text: This product was great for my DD. We used it quite a bit especially in the earlier weeks when we first brought her home. We used the bassinet and as a supplement the sleeper when our daughter would not sleep in the bassinet. Our daughter slept several times in this sleeper and sometimes take naps during the day. Now she sleeps mostly in the bassinet. I read a review about someone finding mold on the mattress. I believe if you stay on top of washing sheets and keeping baby dry as much as possible, this should not be an issue (plus there is a waterproof liner covering mattress pad.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and safe!
customer_reviews.text: This item was recommended by a good friend and is so convenient! I can place this on the couch while I pump to keep baby close enough to tend to him while I'm tied down and in doing so, provides a safe sleeping surface. It is easy to use and travel with (reasonably lightweight and folds down to fit in small spaces), which is very handy when being at other people's houses where there may not be an appropriate sleeping surface. It hasn't gotten soiled so far, so I don't know how easy it is to clean, but I imagine it isn't so difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: False Features: Does Not Incline
customer_reviews.text: The features clearly say it has an adjustable incline for babies that need help with digestion. It's right on the FEATURES section. In fact, it says it has 2 settings. It does not. This wouldn't be a deal-breaker, but reading the Customer Questions section shows that the manufacturer KNOWS that the features section is inaccurate, and has for some time now, and has yet to do anything about it. Why? Probably because more parents are willing to buy it if they think it has those features, and who has time to return everything right? WRONG. This is just false advertising. They've had plenty of time to adjust the features. FAIL dude. Fail.
customer_reviews.author: Nell Picariello

customer_reviews.title: Use all the time
customer_reviews.text: We are 7 weeks in with baby #1 & we use this all the time. It saved us a couple of early nights when he would only sleep if he was right next to us - we put it in the bed & while it was tight in a queen, we were at least able to get a couple hours of rest. Now that we're further along, we use it as a nap spot on the coffee table where we can easily replace a dropped pacifier or attend to other nap interruptions quickly. Would definitely recommend for newborns.
customer_reviews.author: JustSayin'

customer_reviews.title: Provided so much peace of mind.
customer_reviews.text: We loved this co-sleeper. I say loved because our boy has out grown it but we gladly passed it on to my brother and his wife as they are bringing home their new baby boy. Our baby had no trouble sleeping and the noise of him moving wasn’t so loud that it woke him up. We washed the cover several times and it was very durable. One improvement would be a strap or a carrying bag to hold it in the folded position for travel. But overall a fantastic product.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Baby loves it. Life saver!
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves it! definitely a must We had a hard time at the hospital because my baby was crying all night long so I decided to order this the day I came back home, it was delivered the same day and my baby started using it on his second day at home. I tried putting him in his bassinet first but he didn’t like it, the second day with tried with this co sleeper and he did excellent, not crying at all, only when he woke up to eat. I recommend this product 100%
customer_reviews.author: Ana Briceno

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT USE THE MAT PROVIDED!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT USE THE PAD PROVIDED! 3 stars because this is a great bed if you don’t use the pad provided!! Made my little girl sweat when we used it, being it is covered in plastic.. The mat can definitely hold mold if the inside gets wet, so I trashed it!! I placed my Dockatot mat in it and it fits great! Not sure what I would use if I didn’t have that. But you definitely need to use a pad that fits well in the bed! The bars keep it sturdy, I know it’s not going anywhere. The mesh is breathable and gives me piece of mind when my baby girl is sleeping. Great size!
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Got two defective products
customer_reviews.text: Defective! We have gotten two different ones bad both are defective in the same place! The latch in one of the sides is in the wrong spot and that side will not catch. So one whole side support does not work. It just flops around. Obviously a defect in the manufacturing process because it’s exactly the same in both we got.
customer_reviews.author: ajac0586

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: This was a lifesaver honestly I’m a first time mom and having baby sleep in the crib was nerve wrecking. She didn’t want to sleep in her crib at two weeks old. Now three weeks and she’s sleeping great in this. I love it because she can still feel the warmth of my body and she can smell her momma is right next to her. I really thought she wouldn’t like it bc my niece was a no go for this item. I am glad I gave it a try despite my niece experience.
customer_reviews.author: CheMayris

customer_reviews.title: Don’t hesitate! Buy it now!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it was cheaper than other brands. Well I’m here to say that it is a great product and a great price!! Works great and is lightweight and easy to store or take on the road. Soft and mesh is even durable and breathable. This literally gave me 100% peace of mind when we brought home our premie from the nicu. He’s safe in his bed but close to me so I can hear if he chokes. I’m very happy!
customer_reviews.author: nikki

customer_reviews.title: Folds up to bring anywhere and to be used anywhere.  Lasted until she got longer and started rolling
customer_reviews.text: We didn't want to spend too much money on a bassinet and co-sleepers weren't convenient outside of our home. We actually used this and placed it in the crib in the beginning, in the bed with us and or on the floor next to our bed (platform bed a few inches off the ground). We even travelled with this and used it in hotel rooms. We had to stop after our baby grow longer but also began rolling. Worked great for the first 3 months and definitely within our budget.
customer_reviews.author: Dawge

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, sturdy, and Convenient
customer_reviews.text: I received it last week when my baby was 5 weeks old. He likes it. Sleeps long hours in it. I usually place a net over it to prevent mosquitoes from biting him. There's lots of space in it. He should be able to fit in it for several months but he is a tall baby. I don't have to worry about him falling off the bed because surprisingly, he starts rolling and moving all over the bed. The bottom is heavy and sturdy enough to stay put.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Tight squeeze in the bed; otherwise, great!
customer_reviews.text: This co-sleeper was fantastic! This was perfect for our needs the first two months of our newborn’s life. It allowed us to keep her close for those early feeds every two hours through the night, but also kept her safe in our bed! The only complaint that I have was comfortability for my fiancé and I. I can’t imagine this being comfortable for anyone in a bed smaller than a King size. My fiancé is 6’2” and I’m 5’1”, and we used the cosleeper between us in our King size bed. It was cramped! Just keep that in mind when purchasing. Other than that, this product was perfect for those early months to keep baby close and safe!
customer_reviews.author: J. Starner

customer_reviews.title: This is a GREAT little bed!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect little travel bed for our baby, we tried it out the first three nights home from the hospital, was way too cramped for our queen size bed though, and you'll need separate bedding unless you don't mind cold shoulders, because bedding can't go over bassinet.. would not be safe for baby. BUT.. I have used this in our camper for baby's bed and it's the best thing ever!! She's safe in it, sleeps great and best of all it's small and compact. Very happy with this little bed! Thank you for this great invention! Wished I have had this for our first four babies:)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: This had been a total life saver. I have used it so much and rely on it nightly for baby to sleep. This is a great way to do Co sleeping as I'm confident baby is safe but still so close which is really convenient and offers us both the best sleep. Definitely my most used item from my registry and awesome for traveling as well. Love how it folds down for storing.
customer_reviews.author: Shilo

customer_reviews.title: A lifesaver for me
customer_reviews.text: It’s definitely a lifesaver for me! A must-have for cosleeping. I sometimes wake up at midnight panicking that I may have covered my baby with my quilt, only to realize that he is safely and soundly sleeping in there. The sides are a bit high and hard, making it not so easy to pick him up for a night feeding and then put him back, but it’s exactly why it’s safer than the ones with soft and lower sides. After all, it’s almost impossible for me to roll over on it without knowing it. Still, as a worrying mom, I place it as far away from me as possible when I put my precious little one in it at night.
customer_reviews.author: hannahseabird

customer_reviews.title: Boo for the manufacturer lying about the mattress materials
customer_reviews.text: Straight up lies about the mattress. It is made of polyurethane, but the manufacturer says it's 100% polyester. Fix this immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah Hadlow

customer_reviews.title: Great option for co-sleeping
customer_reviews.text: I had reservations about co-sleeping with my baby. My husband had convinced me that I would need to embrace the idea. Enter the SwaddleMe By Your Side Sleeper. It made nursing in the middle of the night more bearable. I didn't have to go far; I just reach into the bassinet, and there is baby. Easy to assemble and disassemble (for travel). Baby slept well in it. For reference, we sleep in a King size bed, so there was ample space for my husband and I with baby in the middle.
customer_reviews.author: laurzbellek

customer_reviews.title: I love this!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for nights that I have my grandson. It is absolutely the best baby purchase thus far. It is affordable. It is comfortable for baby and I am comfortable with my grand baby right beside me. I am finally able to sleep knowing he is safe and secure. I have used it 4 times now. I sent it home with my daughter because it was so great and now I am here on Amazon ordering another one because I can't have mine back. Great Product in my opinion. All new moms and grandma's will love this.
customer_reviews.author: Ronda Cobbs

customer_reviews.title: Better than the pack-n-play
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to provide a safe space for our daughter around the house when she’s hanging out with us. It’s perfect for this! We’ve used it on our couch, on the floor, and on our dining room table (always monitored of course). It provides a sturdy place for her to sleep, but still be close to us, versus setting up the pack-n-play and having her across the room. Both my husband and I like having her with us on the couch - when she’s awake and active we can interact with her better and when she’s sleeping we just like having her near us.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for travel
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a trip when my baby was about 8 weeks old. She weight about 10-11 pounds at the time. This was a perfect place for her to sleep while giving me peace of mind. I personally wouldn’t use this long term or as a sleeping option at home but it’s perfect for travel! I slept in a queen size bed with this little basinet next to me and it was perfect. My baby is now almost 3 months old and a little over 12lbs. She can still fit in it but will outgrow it very soon.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlyn S

customer_reviews.title: Not for us
customer_reviews.text: Too big for even a king size bed and soft bottom so baby can't be moved from place to place in it. My baby didn't like it and still prefered to be snuggled at night which defeated the purpose of this product. May work for other babies though.
customer_reviews.author: baustin

customer_reviews.title: Great bed for newborn to about 4 months
customer_reviews.text: My son has slept in this bed every night. He still fits in it at 4 months but we decided to go ahead and give him something that had more room to move around. This works great for cosleeping. The only negative is that the bars that go from the rails around the top to the bottom aren’t very padded. Baby would sometimes hit his head on them. I solved that easily by folding a receiving blanket into a strip and tucking one end under the mattress and the other under the bed.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Best solution to sleeping in bed with your little.
customer_reviews.text: I cannot speak highly enough about this product. My baby was a preemie with respiratory issues so I wanted her close. This bassinet is the perfect solution for sleeping SAFELY in the bed. The ONLY reason why I gave 4 instead of 5 stars is because it does lean toward me in the bed and lets babe roll a little. But I fixed that with the Boppy wedge that I used during pregnancy. Problem solved. And I do wish the bottom had a hard surface to flatten the mattress. Please, if you are dead set on sleeping with your little in the bed, consider this bassinet as an alternative to those others with bumpers.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Safe for baby while co-sleeping
customer_reviews.text: This little sleeper will definitely guard your baby while in bed, especially if younger kids are also sleeping in the same bed... It’s build strong and just the right size. Highly recommend it. My baby started sleeping there a few days as a newborn, then transferred her to a dock a tot until about 3 months old, then back in this sleeper. She is now 5 months old and still fits, hoping she can fit in it until 6 months of age.
customer_reviews.author: Lady

customer_reviews.title: Would work best on a firm mattress
customer_reviews.text: Would work best on a firm mattress. Our mattress is older and I felt that my daughter would end up squished against one side. I don’t think it would work in a queen with two adults. My husband and I are both average size and couldn’t sleep comfortably with this co-sleeper in bed. I liked that I didn’t have to worry about rolling on top of her and having her close by. The sheet is pretty stiff, but we just replaced with a pillowcase and that worked really well.
customer_reviews.author: Lexie

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I’ve already bought two of these, one for me and one for my nephew. It is sturdy and we used it for 5 months until our kids got too big for it. Honestly it could probably go up to 8 months but they started crawling out of it and we had to swap it out and get them in to cribs. But this product was easy to assemble and also to fold apart so that they can be taken anywhere easily.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Makes life easier
customer_reviews.text: We are excited new parents so we want to keep our newborn baby in sight as much as possible. We use a playard-bassinet in our bedroom but was so big to move around, that is why I looked for a portable nice bassinet for day time. I am so happy with it, we use it in our living room during day time, well built, cute and comfy. When we need to drop the baby off to his grandma, we take the bassinet also, so he has a safe sleeping place over there aswell.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The sleeper is sturdy and was the best sleep solution for our little ...
customer_reviews.text: Our baby slept in this all day and night when he was a newborn up until about 2.5 months old. The sleeper is sturdy and was the best sleep solution for our little one. We love that it has a breathable mesh on the side to prevent overheating. It fit perfectly in our bed and we carried it around the house to put the baby in to sleep since it is light and portable. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kenny K. Lee

customer_reviews.title: which doesn't sound like such a bad thing until you realize the baby ...
customer_reviews.text: The mat isn't very firm, which doesn't sound like such a bad thing until you realize the baby sinks/rolls with the fluctuation of the mat.
customer_reviews.author: Kim W

customer_reviews.title: This is the BEST!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was a life saver. I wanted my baby close but didn’t want to have him just free in my bed, this was the perfect solution. We had him in the middle of my husband and I but safe in his own enclosure. It was concenient for late night nursing, being able to quickly pick him up without having to get up. He sleeps better being so close to us. I 1000% would recommend this and I would use this 1000x over a regular bedside bassinet.
customer_reviews.author: Erinlazgrant

customer_reviews.title: Gave me peace in those early days
customer_reviews.text: This was very helpful in the early days of having a newborn. It made me nervous to leave her in her bassinet or crib, so we slept with her in our bed in this sleeper for the first month or so of her life. They outgrow it quickly but it’s easy to clean and pass on to another nervous mama. I don’t regret purchasing it for our peace of mind and to keep baby close!
customer_reviews.author: castmember19

customer_reviews.title: The only way we’ve gotten great sleep!
customer_reviews.text: My newborn hated his bedside bassinet, and my husband and I were desperate for a safe sleeping solution. Sleeping with him on our chests in shifts was not cutting it. We bought this bassinet for in the bed and all three of us are sleeping so much better now! We have a king size bed, so we all fit comfortably. Anything smaller than a king might feel pretty tight. So glad we purchased this!!
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Bassinet
customer_reviews.text: I have enjoyed this bassinet. My 5 month old is in the 90th percentile in length, and she still fits in the bassinet. However, we are going to transfer her to her crib now that she is out-growing it, but it has been very convenient. It does not fit on a Queen bed with two average adults (which I was aware from reading other reviews), but was a great size for staying at a hotel and visiting family. The sheet covering the water proof pad is thin, but it worked fine and washed well.
customer_reviews.author: erconder

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Our little guy loves this portable sleeper bassinet. We used it between us in the beginning and when we put him in his crib we use it because he’s still very small for the crib. Definitely need a queen or king size bed to make it comfortable to have in between two people. Great for travel or just to have him nap near you in different parts of the house.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Benzinger

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Content
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great tool for co-sleeping, except that it doesn't fit my husband and I and the baby all in a queen-sized bed. If you're going to use if to sleep between you two, you really need a king-sized bed. I would say that my hubby and I are average height and weight, and it just was too tight of a fit. Newborns don't really like laying on the flat surface, so a wedge would help in the design, but I feel safe putting her in the bed with the metal frame!
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had this all along. I bought it when my daughter was about 5 weeks old and it’s so perfect for our needs. We don’t cosleep but during the day and whenever we’re just hanging out, she naps in here so well! She’s gone to her grandmas for sleepovers twice and this is so easy to throw in the trunk of the car. Seems well made and overall very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: N T

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This helped us finally get some sleep at night! My baby refused to sleep in a regular basinet. I decided to give this a try and it worked like a charm! The first night of use gave 4 straight hours of sleep. It allows comfort to baby to know you’re close by, and eases for parent to check on baby. My only complaint is that the mesh portionin the middle is not as elastic as shown in the video, it’s actually pretty rigid. Other than that, would recommend
customer_reviews.author: babrm

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Best option I saw out there for the price. It folds away easily. Took a star off because I am not crazy about the cold steel bars next to my skin and in a bed. But the baby is protected from it. Just wish they had covered those ugly bars for a less medical sterile feel and cozied it up since that is the essential idea/feel behind the co-sleeper -- to cozy up to your newborn. But no regrets!!
customer_reviews.author: Branchi

customer_reviews.title: Mattress could be firmer/flat
customer_reviews.text: This bassinet helped us keep a close eye on our newborn baby for about 2 weeks then as our baby gained weight we noticed that the mattress wasnt firm enough to keep our baby flat on it cause the bassinet would shape kinda like a hammock.,it was great in the beggining, but it did not last long.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Zzzzzz
customer_reviews.text: Soft cushion, easy to pull out, no putting it together. Plesantly bigger than you would expect, mesh siding for airflow. We have a cold room and the mesh enables the heat to keep the inside of the bassinet warm. If you have a pillowtop or a squishy bed, i dont recommend using this as your baby may roll to the side. This even comes with its own removable sheet. Good thing for me because my baby had a blowout the first night he was in it.
customer_reviews.author: kayla

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great product. My daughter co sleeps in this in our bed. I love that the side has a soft part so I can bend and get her in the middle of the night. I just dont like the mattress part, they could have used a better product there. The mattress cover is also easily washable . During the day we put it on our sofa and baby sleeps in ot. Overall I liked this product.
customer_reviews.author: Adrineh

customer_reviews.title: I love this
customer_reviews.text: To be honest this sleeper does take up a decent amount of space in the bed, I have a queen and me and my fiancé were really smushed. But I got to lay in my own bed with my baby at arms reach in a safe sleeping area. We probably used it for less than a month(because we were really getting cramped) but it was really a life saver. If I had a king size bed or if it was just me and baby it would have been even better
customer_reviews.author: Jahcinda Marina

customer_reviews.title: So Convenient!
customer_reviews.text: I took a star off because it seems impossible to find more mattress covers. Otherwise, I am getting a lot of use out of this - it is so convenient and it gets used every day - naps, diaper changes, back and sometimes tummy time, a quick place to safely stash baby while I get food or prep the moby wrap. Pretty lightweight and easy enough to carry from room to room. Update: My baby is now 6 months and since he's rolling over and lifting himself to grab things over the sides, I don't leave him unattended in it anymore, but still use this occasionally because it's so convenient still for diaper changes.
customer_reviews.author: Khi

customer_reviews.title: Helpful sleeper
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because our newborn wouldn't sleep in his crib and I felt really uncomfortable sleeping with him in our bed. This thing is amazing. He can sleep next to us without us having to worry about hurting him. The one down side is it is a little small so he won't be able to sleep in it for longer than a few months. However, every parent knows how precious sleep is, so those few months are worth the money in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: LisaBaughman

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase yet!
customer_reviews.text: Having a bedside bassinet just wasn't working for us. The baby always wanted to be close and we had heard not to co sleep no matter what, for the safety of the baby. Got this after a week on her only sleeping maybe an hour at a time, and it is truly a blessing. She now sleeps comfortably between us at night and will sleep a good 3 to 4 hours at a time. There were many options for a bassinet tha5 goes in the bed, but this one fits our needs perfectly and was a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better the a crib safer than the Doc-a-tot!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I bought this! It's very helpful if you are wanting to co-sleep. My husband and I still fit in our queen size bed perfect. The night light it comes with has sounds that will put the baby to sleep with ease. My new loved it from the first day we can home for the hospital. It's very good travel packed bed as well. The wall keep the baby safe from suffocating. This product is very safe and easy to wash. Also light! No need to worry about putting it together it jut pops up and bam! That's it all you have to do.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Walker

customer_reviews.title: Buy Dock a Tot or the Moses basket instead
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: This thing NEEDS a solid bottom. Makes it really annoying to move and doesn’t feel stable for baby. My baby wakes almost the second I put her in this and I wish I could return it. Although I haven’t gotten to use it yet, it seems decent. BUT I really don’t like that the bottom isn’t flat and structured. We’ll see how it goes soon.
customer_reviews.author: Carmella B

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel; impractical for sleeping.
customer_reviews.text: There was nothing wrong with the product, my son just didn't take to it well. It was very easy to fold so it would be a perfect travel bassinet. The mesh on the side makes it easy to see baby and gave me the comfort that he could breathe well in it. The only complaint I really have is that you have to sit up fully in bed in order to take the baby out because the metal on the sides makes it impossible to lift baby from a horizontal position.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar

customer_reviews.title: Great For On-The-Go!
customer_reviews.text: We used this recently on a multi-state trip. I needed something smaller than a pack and play for my little one to sleep in at night. It's a perfect size. My little one is 5 months old and still fits in this, however, I bet when he reaches 6 months he will be too big. One con is that there's nothing to protect the leg parts when you break it down, which it would have been nice to been provided with some caps so that it doesn't scratch things up in transit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazoness Warrior

customer_reviews.title: Fits well on bed but didn’t work for me
customer_reviews.text: I’m sure these are great for going places with your newborn. Mine never took to it so I ended up getting a Full size co sleeper bassinet that attaches to the bed anyway. The mattress pad cover is smooth but not very comfy or breathable, though it’s nice there is a cover. The whole thing fit well on my bed, but I couldn’t see using it long term.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth R.

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the price it was good. I used it for 3 months or so. Eventually I ended up cosleeping with my baby (judge me go ahead) and this is now a taking up space in my closet. The one thing I wish it did was have the capacity to move my baby while she was sleeping on it. It has a soft surface so once they’re in that’s it, you’re stuck lol which as a first time mom I didn’t think it would be a big deal however now that I know more I do wish I would have gotten one that I could move wherever I was going.
customer_reviews.author: Andi M.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t need it
customer_reviews.text: At first I bought this because of my paranoia about cosleeping, but the hard metal and bulkiness of this cosleeper made me realize that we don’t need it. Me and my husband happily cosleep with our baby without any barriers separating us and our baby. Also I’m not sure if this was supposed to come with instructions, but we can’t seem to be able to fold it away.
customer_reviews.author: Judith

customer_reviews.title: Gave peace of mind to TIRED first time mom
customer_reviews.text: Used from newborn-3 months. Had a very colicky and fussy sleeper, and this gave me peace of mind when bed sharing. It was easy to set up, easy to break down, and easy to transport when traveling. We love it so much we’re keeping it for baby #2 (whenever that may happen)
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Not for us
customer_reviews.text: This serves the purpose of a bassinet on the go, but it is awkward and large and there is never a good place for it in a hotel room.... I returned it for something that we could put her in and put her in bed between us at a hotel. This was just too large and the metal made it hard for me to reach over to get to baby at night.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Like not love.
customer_reviews.text: To be fair, I'd give it a 3.5 star review. It works as advertised but what would make this so much better is if there was a sturdy base under the bedding so you can carry the sleeper around while the baby is in it. But the bedding is the only base and would sag if you tried to lift the sleeper with the baby in it. Also, I personally believe that's it's much more convenient and comfortable to have your baby sleep in a bassinet next to your bed.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Truong

customer_reviews.title: It's easy to transport so I would take it to the ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how I would have survived those first few weeks without this! The mesh sides gave me peace of mind, and my baby likes feeling enclosed. I've been placing this inside of the pack and play by my bedside. It's easy to transport so I would take it to the living room during the day. One thing to note (that it says on the instructions), don't move it with the baby inside as the bottom is not hard/secure. I am giving it 4 stars because I wish it came with a carrying tote. I ended up using a zippered pillow bag for packing up for overnight trips.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Loud materials, but great little crib
customer_reviews.text: The water proof cover on the mattress is very loud so we cut it off. Standard changing table sheets fit well on the mattress pad. There is there world's loudest tag on one end of the crib that woke our baby up when we would kick it, I was able to remove without damaging the crib wall mesh. It's very light and fits great on our king sized bed. I feel like it would be a little tight on a queen size.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lee

customer_reviews.title: SWADDLE ME
customer_reviews.text: DOESN'T FOLD UP THEY ARE LYING YOU HAVE TO PULL IT APART, THIS MUST BE A DUMMY MODEL PROTOTYPE THE MATERIAL ON THE BEDDING MAKES YOUR BABY SWEAT SKIN CAN'T BREATHE GOOD, IT'S CUTE BUT A BIG WASTE OF MONEY, PLEASE FIX IT.
customer_reviews.author: THE BARBIE DOLL

customer_reviews.title: Life saving!!
customer_reviews.text: Omg. This thing is a lifesaver! I ordered this for my then 2 month old baby, because she only wanted to sleep being held, and we never quite felt safe sleeping this way. I em also we’re operating on nearly zero sleep. This in bed bassinet is perfect, because she’s still safe and contained while still feeling close to us. She now sleeps in 3-4 hour stretches between feedings AND is doing much better being put down for naps in her other bassinet during the day. I’m so grateful! Everyone go buy this right now!
customer_reviews.author: designerjoy1

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS FOR CO-SLEEPING!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. It actually keeps my baby safe while co-sleeping because the sides are medal and not soft. I also moved this to her crib when we transitioned her to her own room and it helped tremendously! This way she feels more secure and her feet can touch the bottom which helps soothe herself. It was definitely worth the money and I think a much better product than other MUCH more expensive options!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Shelton

customer_reviews.title: I like the mesh sides
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to be able to co-sleep safely. My daughter loves to be near me to sleep. I usually had to hold her to sleep at night. I like the mesh sides. The only con I have is when you try to move it, the velcro on the bottom catches my comforter. It always wakes up the baby and my husband. The mattress in it is about the same to one in a bassinet. That didn't bother me.
customer_reviews.author: Knreynolds

customer_reviews.title: For king size bed or sit-up nursing only
customer_reviews.text: Most parents who co-sleep with baby also nurse rather than bottle feed, and this product takes up too much space in a queen size bed for lying down nursing to be possible on both sides. If you are a mother who will reliably wake up, sit up, nurse, and replace baby, then this will work for you. If you nurse lying down, then the baby will fall out of your bed. I am very petite, and with this product in the middle of our queen size bed, there was only a maximum of five inches left between me and the edge of our mattress. It was a nice thought for a product, but not functional for us.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: Safe to cosleep with baby in the bed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I wanted a safe in the bed cosleeper. All the sides are mesh which I love because I know my baby is safe if her face ends up against the sides. The vibration soothes her and the sound machine stops after an amount of time. We don’t use the night light but it’s a nice feature. She likes the small space and tends to sleep a lot better in this than in her portacrib, but we also put it inside her portacrib when we don’t have it in the bed.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: A waste
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't figure out for the other of me how to unfold which you'd think would be simple enough- there were no instructions that came with the box. Bought because I am bedsharing with my infant and thought he would sleep in it but everytime I put him in it he wakes up and screams bloody murder.. to late to return so it's just storage for baby items on my bed.
customer_reviews.author: grantd2089

customer_reviews.title: ... in between us while we sleep makes it very easy to breastfeed in bed without having to get up ...
customer_reviews.text: Keeps baby safe in between us while we sleep makes it very easy to breastfeed in bed without having to get up and go get baby. I'm very happy with this product I was also very impressed with how nice of quality this sleeper is, because the picture does not do it justice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I used this in-bed sleeper with my baby for about 8 weeks before I transitioned her to a crib and I am still in so love with this product. I'm actually writing this review as my daughter is now 2 and a half years old. This little bed made our lives so much easier when she was an infant. As a single mother who had a rough delivery, having my baby right by my side safely was such a beautiful experience. It made midnight wake ups much easier on my body and on her! I loved being close to her. I am truly grateful to have found this product and I HIGHLY recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Missy

customer_reviews.title: Comically small
customer_reviews.text: What babies actually even fit in this thing? I bought it for my 6 week old and he couldn’t even stretch his arms it was so tiny.
customer_reviews.author: another opinion

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeper with a bit too-soft sleep pad.
customer_reviews.text: We bought the sleeper as a temporary solution as the crib is in our nursing room which is blocked by a house project. The sleeper is easy to fold / unfold, and the frame feels solid. The pad feels okay as my newborn can sleep on it and I can move it without worrying it drops out. One improvement I'd like to see from the sleeper is to provide an option to insert a more solid base, as I prefer my newborn to sleep on a harder surface.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: I loved it! I did not have to worry about ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I are bigger people and I believe in co-sleeping but my husband is a deep sleeper so I decided to buy this for our second child. I loved it! I did not have to worry about any one of us accidentally rolling on him or that he would roll or turn and suffocate on the sides. I also love it that it folds so we can take it to places. I only wish it was a little longer or could be extended as my babies tend to grow very fast and big.
customer_reviews.author: Soua

customer_reviews.title: Great for peace of mind!
customer_reviews.text: We love this. Gives peace of mind so baby can be close to me, but also safe in her own space. My husband and I put this between us (on top of the covers) for the first month for our baby. It was a tight fit on our queen sized bed, but we made it work. I like the fact that we could move this anywhere and she can nap in it anywhere!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Thiele
